result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth M Blackman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent. Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment; and or schooling.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Anger management and domestic violence counseling. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. No contact with the victim M.L. and D.L. (person, property, residence or family). Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Pay all court costs and supervision fees. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  AMENDED 10-17-2022:  Court ordered financial obligations amended to include attorney fees.

9:45 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kenneth M Blackman in court, in custody.  Attorney Donald L. Conner II in court for Kenneth M Blackman. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Matter set for COP date. 
Defense indicates he has worked out everything with the State but need time to get through the paperwork. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Atty Conner indicates he had issues getting into the jail do to their new policy, requests to be heard on bond at the next date. 
BTC: Matter set will be set for plea/sentencing and can review bond at next date too if the COP doesnt go forward.

Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victim M.L (person, property, residence or family). Defendant is to be placed on HOUSE ARREST with GPS monitoring through Racine County Alternatives Program (717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine). Defendant MAY ONLY BE RELEASED to the supervision of RCAP.  Exceptions to house arrest are court, attorney and defendant's medical appointments. Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:37 PM Prosecuting attorney Antoinette L. Rich appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Kenneth M Blackman appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez appeared by video for Kenneth M Blackman. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Victim appears via zoom.
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
